intro: Tephrocactus neuquensis, commonly known as the Neuquén cactus, is a species native to Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in spines. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent structure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, blooming in spring. Tephrocactus neuquensis is a relatively small cactus, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter.
